description: Conversion of roof space to habitable use to include a side dormer with rear balcony. Erection of rear conservatory and conversion of integral garage to habitable accommodation (Application for a Certificate of Lawful Development for a Proposed Development)
decision_conditions: The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue  of the provisions of paragraph A.1 (f)(i)(ii), Class A, Schedule 2, Part 1, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the total enlargement (i.e. the existing two-storey rear extension and proposed conservatory) would extend beyond the rear wall of the original detached dwellinghouse by more than 4 metres and exceed 4 metres in height

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of paragraph A.1 (h)(i), Class A, Schedule 2, Part 1, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the total enlargement  (i.e. the existing two-storey rear extension and proposed conservatory) would have more than a single storey and extend beyond the rear wall of the original dwelling house by more than 3 metres.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of paragraph A.1 (i), Class A, Schedule 2, Part 1, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the total enlargement would be within 2 metres of the boundary of the curtilage of the dwellinghouse, and the height of the eaves of the enlarged part would exceed 3 metres.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of paragraph B.1(e) (i), Class B, Schedule 2, Part 1, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the proposed roof extension would include a balcony.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Condition B.2(a), Class B, Schedule 2, Part 1, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because it has not be demonstrated that the materials used in the exterior work of the proposed roof extension will be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse.

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Condition B.2(c)(i)(ii), Class B, Schedule 2, Part 1, Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because it has not been demonstrated that the proposed side dormer windows will be obscure glazed, and non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.
